comments:
latest pde.core/pde.ui/pde.build from head.

1. Create an RCP product as descirbed in bug 84511.
2. Unzip it.
3. As a workaround to bug 84511, manually create a create a configuration/ 
subdirectory into the eclipse root directory, and cut/paste the config.ini 
file into that subdirectory.

4. Try to run the product by double-clicking on eclipse.exe,
you will get the following error in the log:

!SESSION Sat Feb 05 00:20:32 EST 2005 -----------------------------------------
-
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Feb 05, 2005 24:20:32.871
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.io.FileNotFoundException: 
d:\Temp\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.osgi\eclipse.properties (The system cannot 
find the path specified)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.file.FileURLConnection.connect(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.file.FileURLConnection.getInputStream(Unknown 
Source)
	at java.net.URL.openStream(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.load(Main.java:1252)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.loadProperties(Main.java:1224)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.addBaseJars(Main.java:441)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getDevPath(Main.java:393)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getBootPath(Main.java:519)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:250)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:817)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:801)


Not sure why Main is not looking in org.eclipse.osgi_3.1.0 for the 
eclipse.properties file.  Also not sure why that file is mandatory.

Observe the generated config.ini file.  It is fine.

There is a problem with the value specified in the osgi.framework property.
It seems that the startup and fwk do not like plaform URL as a way to specify
the fwk location.

Instead I recommend that you simply don't specify a value for the fwk since the
startup.jar knows where to find it.

I will check what are / should be the supported values for the fwk.
Jeff any idea?

not generating the osgi.framework key solved the problem.

The value that I put in however was compliant with the comments in the 
config.ini that ships with eclipse.

Another format which the runtime recognizes when I generate a config.ini for 
the runtime app is:
osgi.framework=file:d:/Eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.osgi_3.1.0/
*** Bug 91968 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I'm experiencing this same problem when trying to debug a workbench instance.  I
started with a new workspace, using 3.1M6.  I imported the plugins I wanted to
debug and generated a new Eclipse Application launch configuration with all
defaults.  When I launch this configuration, I get
java.io.FileNotFoundException:
/home/tools/eclipse/3.1M6/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.osgi_3.1.0.jar/eclipse.properties
(Not a directory).
comment 4 is a separate (minor) PDE issue.  I'll open a bug report for it.
